definition: to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to choke on (food etc)/to swallow the wrong way

sentences.english: Water went down his throat and he started to choke.
sentences.chinese: 水进入他的喉咙，他开始呛住了。

sentences.english: Fang Qiong always speaks with someone choking choking, let a person feel not good get along with.
sentences.chinese: 方琼说话总是跟别人呛呛，让人觉得不好相处。

sentences.english: Fang Qiong always speaks with someone choking choking, let a person feel not good get along with.
sentences.chinese: 方琼说话总是跟别人呛呛，让人觉得不好相处。

sentences.english: He choked on a mouthful of water while swimming.
The swordman only felt a sudden pain on his wrist and dropped his sword.
sentences.chinese: 那剑士只觉腕上一阵剧痛，呛啷一声，长剑落地。

sentences.english: However, there are also some leaders who dare not to talk much in order that their official position are safe.
sentences.chinese: 当然，也有部分领袖为了保住本身的官位而不敢呛声。

sentences.english: The smoke choked the joking stroker at one stroke.
sentences.chinese: 烟一下呛住了开玩哭的抚摸者。

sentences.english: It was so terrible. I choked several times on water.
sentences.chinese: 当时太糟了，我在水里呛了好几次。

sentences.english: I malicious Qiang one mouthful, cough soon dying.
sentences.chinese: 我狠狠呛了一口，咳得快要死去。

sentences.english: The smoke afraid the badinage achievementr at one stroke.
sentences.chinese: 烟一下呛住了开玩笑的抚摸者。

sentences.english: The smoke afraid the badinage stroker at one achievement.
sentences.chinese: 烟一下呛住了开打趣的抚摩者。

sentences.english: The pungent, choking smell of sulphur filled the air.
sentences.chinese: 空气中弥漫着刺鼻呛人的硫磺气味。

sentences.english: Ralph, Sr . chokes on his whiskey at the sound of the scream.
sentences.chinese: 大拉尔夫正在喝威士忌酒，听到尖叫声，呛了一口。

sentences.english: His remarks prompted angry shouts from Arab-Israeli lawmakers.
sentences.chinese: 他的讲话引起阿拉伯裔以色列议员的愤怒呛声。

sentences.english: He heard his employees keening and wailing over lost data.
sentences.chinese: 他听到雇员们因为数据丢失呛天呼地。

definition: to choke on (food etc)/to swallow the wrong way
spout/spray/belch/to well up/to puff out/to spurt out
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
sound of sighing/(interjection expressing surprise, sorrow, regret, disappointment etc) oh/damn/wow
to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
